law.catch_line: Licensure without examination -- Reciprocal agreement between states.
law.text: The board may grant the appropriate license without examination to any person who at the time of application holds a valid license from another state and who meets the current minimum requirements for licensure in Kentucky provided a reciprocal agreement exists between the states.
law.history: Amended 1976 Ky. Acts ch. 305, sec. 6. -- Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 279, sec. 12.
